Package project.star_wars_universe.models.jedi

Class Jedi

java.lang.Object
project.star_wars_universe.models.jedi.Jedi
public class Jedi extends Object
Represents a jedi. This is one of the main entities of the application.

  • Field Details

    • name

      private final String name
      The jedi's name. It is immutable and should not be null or empty.

    • rank

      private Rank rank
      The jedi's rank. It should not be null.

    • age

      private int age
      The jedi's age. It should be larger than 0 and smaller than 1000.

    • saberColor

      private SaberColor saberColor
      The jedi's saber color. It should not be null.

    • power

      private double power
      The jedi's power. It should be larger than 0 and smaller than 1000.

  • Constructor Details

    • Jedi

      public Jedi(String name, Rank rank, int age, SaberColor saberColor, double power) throws InvalidRankException, InvalidAgeException, InvalidSaberColorException, InvalidPowerException, InvalidNameException
      Initializes the Jedi instance. The jedi name is validated and set in the constructor itself (it doesn't have a setter because it's immutable), while the other fields are validated through their setter methods.
      Parameters:
      name - the jedi's name
      rank - the jedi's rank
      age - the jedi's age
      saberColor - the jedi's saber color
      power - the jedi's power
      Throws:
      InvalidRankException - if the value for rank is invalid.
      InvalidAgeException - if the value for age is invalid.
      InvalidSaberColorException - if the value for saber color is invalid.
      InvalidPowerException - if the value for power is invalid.
      InvalidNameException - if the value for name is invalid.

    • getPower

      public double getPower()
      Gets the jedi's power.
      Returns:
      the jedi's power.

    • setPower

      public void setPower(double power) throws InvalidPowerException
      Sets the jedi's power.
      Parameters:
      power - the jedi's power.
      Throws:
      InvalidPowerException - if the jedi's power is less than 0 or more than 1000.

    • promoteJedi

      public void promoteJedi(double multiplier) throws InvalidPromotionMultiplierException, HighestRankReachedException, InvalidPowerException
      Promotes the jedi. First, the Rank instance corresponding to the next rank order is extracted. Then it checks whether the promotion multiplier is larger than 0. If it is, the jedi's power is set to [current_power + (current_power * multiplier)] and the jedi's rank is set to the next one in the hierarchy.
      Parameters:
      multiplier - the multiplier by which the jedi should be promoted.
      Throws:
      InvalidPromotionMultiplierException - if the promotion multiplier is less than or equal to 0.
      HighestRankReachedException - if the highest rank is reached for the jedi.
      InvalidPowerException - if the power exceeds the allowed limits when it gets set to its new value.

    • demoteJedi

      public void demoteJedi(double multiplier) throws InvalidPromotionMultiplierException, LowestRankReachedException, InvalidPowerException
      Demotes the jedi. First, the Rank instance corresponding to the previous rank order is extracted. Then it checks whether the promotion multiplier is larger than 0. If it is, the jedi's power is set to [current_power - (current_power * multiplier)] and the jedi's rank is set to the previous one in the hierarchy.
      Parameters:
      multiplier - the multiplier by which the jedi should be demoted.
      Throws:
      InvalidPromotionMultiplierException - if the promotion multiplier is less than or equal to 0.
      LowestRankReachedException - if the lowest rank is reached for the jedi.
      InvalidPowerException - if the power exceeds the allowed limits when it gets set to its new value.
